com.quorum.tessera.key

Interface KeyManager

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    KeyManagerImpl

    public interface KeyManager
    Manages local keys for the running node, include key lookups and key loading/generation

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Key defaultPublicKey()
      Returns the default public key of this node if a transaction is sent that doesn't have a sender.
      Set<Key> getForwardingKeys()
      Returns a set of public keys that all transactions should be sent to in addition to the declared recipients

      Fetches the private key that corresponds to the given public key This means that the returned private key is under control of the current node (i.e.
      Key getPublicKeyForPrivateKey(Key privateKey)
      Fetches the public key that corresponds to the given private key This means that the returned public key is under control of the current node (i.e.
      Set<Key> getPublicKeys()
      Return a list of all recipients public keys of this node

    • Method Detail

      • getPublicKeyForPrivateKey

        Key getPublicKeyForPrivateKey(Key privateKey)
        Fetches the public key that corresponds to the given private key This means that the returned public key is under control of the current node (i.e. it is one of our keys)
        Parameters:
        privateKey - the private key for which to find the public key
        Returns:
        the corresponding public key
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - if the private key could not be found

      • getPrivateKeyForPublicKey

        Key getPrivateKeyForPublicKey(Key publicKey)
        Fetches the private key that corresponds to the given public key This means that the returned private key is under control of the current node (i.e. it is one of our keys)
        Parameters:
        publicKey - the public key for which to find the private key
        Returns:
        the corresponding private key
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - if the public key could not be found

      • getPublicKeys

        Set<Key> getPublicKeys()
        Return a list of all recipients public keys of this node
        Returns:
        the set of all public keys

      • defaultPublicKey

        Key defaultPublicKey()
        Returns the default public key of this node if a transaction is sent that doesn't have a sender.

        Must return the same key each time during a single run, but no guarantee is made about which key is returned if the application is restarted.

        Returns:
        The public key to use as the default sender

      • getForwardingKeys

        Set<Key> getForwardingKeys()
        Returns a set of public keys that all transactions should be sent to in addition to the declared recipients
        Returns:
        the set of keys to forward to
